exercise: How many ways can 5 people be arranged in a row?
How many 3-digit numbers can be formed using the digits 1-5 without repetition?
A committee of 4 people is chosen from 10 people. How many committees are possible?
How many ways can you select 3 books from 8 books?
How many words (meaningful or not) can be formed using all letters of MATH?
In how many ways can you arrange the letters of BOOK?
How many subsets does a set with 6 elements have?
A pizza shop offers 8 toppings. How many different 3-topping pizzas are possible?
How many ways can you distribute 5 identical candies to 3 children?
In how many ways can 3 boys and 2 girls be arranged if boys must sit together?
How many 4-letter words can be formed from the letters of BANANA?
How many ways can you choose a president and vice president from 12 people?
How many non-negative integer solutions are there to $x+y+z=10$?
A lock has 4 digits. Each digit can be 0-9. How many combinations exist?
In how many ways can you select at least one item from 5 distinct items?
How many diagonals does a regular octagon have?
How many ways can you arrange the letters of SUCCESS?
In how many ways can 6 people sit at a circular table?
How many handshakes occur when 10 people each shake hands once?
How many positive divisors does $2^3 \cdot 3^2 \cdot 5$ have?
In how many ways can you partition 5 distinct objects into 2 non-empty groups?
How many ways can you roll a sum of 7 with two dice?
How many bit strings of length 6 contain exactly three 1's?
